On Wed, 05 Mar 2003 18:54:19 -0500, Scott Stirling wrote:

>> From: Roman Rytov [mailto:rrytov@...]
>>
>> Surprisingly fail of JUnit crashes my WindowsXP copmuter to blue-
>> screen. Whenever I get an error in JUnit UI-window next click to close
>> the window leads the computer to crash. Ideas?
> 
> It's probably a JVM and graphics driver problem.  Someone was discussing
> this on the TDD list recently.  Apparently there's a bug in the JVM and/or
> Windows XP graphics driver (not sure who the guilty party really is) for
> some video cards.  I believe the solution is to get the latest and
> greatest release of 1.4 from Sun, where they've put in a patch for the
> problem.

Just to clarify, there's definitely a kernel-level bug in there somewhere
-- either in the graphics driver (or some other driver) or core kernel
code. No application should be able to cause a blue-screen. Ever.

> Scott Stirling

Cheers,

Colin
subject: RE: Java 1.4 and JUnit. Contradiction?
